kickstart.post:
# install postgres yum --enablerepo base update openssl yum install postgresql91 yum install postgresql91-devel yum install postgresql91-server
# FIXME ? yum install postgresql91-jdbc # FIXME ? yum --enablerepo base install unixODBC # FIXME ? yum install postgresql91-odbc
yum install postgresql91-docs yum install postgresql91-python
#yum install postgresql91-plpython #yum install postgresql91-pltcl
yum --enablerepo=base install uuid yum install postgresql91-contrib
#yum install postgresql91-libs
yum install postgresql91-test yum install pgbouncer
# install postgis export PATH=/usr/pgsql-9.1/bin:$PATH yum --enablerepo epel install json-c.x86_64
# this installs proj and geos rpms yum install postgis2_91
# set mode to strict (2) to prevent postgres being killed by OOM /sbin/sysctl -w vm.overcommit_memory=2
# Postgres (for lifemapper) # Set overcommit_memory mode to strict to reduce chances of OOM killer invocation vm.overcommit_memory = 2
# create unix socket dir for postgres and pgbounser mkdir -p /var/run/postgresql chown postgres:postgres /var/run/postgresql
# add unix socket info for postgres user
PGHOST=/var/run/postgresql export PGHOST
/opt/lifemapper/rocks/bin/lmserver_init
# start postgres export PGHOST=/var/run/postgresql PG=`basename /etc/init.d/postgresql-*` /sbin/chkconfig $PG on /sbin/chkconfig --add $PG /sbin/service $PG initdb /sbin/service $PG start
# init postgrexs db with user info /opt/lifemapper/rocks/bin/db_init
# create md5 auth client info in config file /opt/lifemapper/rocks/bin/confPostgres ca /sbin/service $PG restart
# start pgbouncer BOUNCER=/etc/init.d/pgbouncer /sbin/chkconfig $BOUNCER on /sbin/chkconfig --add $BOUNCER /sbin/service $BOUNCER start
# may need this later for postgres tuning # rocks set network mtu public 9000 # rocks sync host network `hostname -s`
